title: First Look Trailer for 'El Tesoro de Barracuda' Spanish Animated Film
description: "If you can read these pages, it means you are looking for my treasure." Filmax in Spain has revealed the first teaser trailer for a new animated adventure film titled El Tesoro de Barracuda, or The Treasure of Barracuda in English, based on the book series of the same name. This thrilling new pirate adventure has all the usual ingredients: secret maps, chases, naval battles, and unforgettable characters. On board the dreaded ship The Southern Cross, she's the only hope for an illiterate crew to find the legendary treasure of Phineas Krane. Together with Captain Barracuda & John La Ballena, protector of Sparks, they will form an unforgettable trio. The big twist: the pirates can't read. But Sparks will teach them! Of course. No voice cast is listed yet. From director Adrià García, the Spanish production is animated by Hampa Animation Studio in Valencia, produced by Inicia Films and Belvision. This is designed for kids, to teach them about the joys of reading, but it still looks like fun anyway. And this colorful 2D animation style is lovely. Check it out below. Here's the first teaser trailer (+ poster) for Adrià García's film El Tesoro de Barracuda, from YouTube: While […]
author: Alex Billington
excerpt: "If you can read these pages, it means you are looking for my treasure." Filmax in Spain has revealed the first teaser trailer for a new animated adventure film titled El Tesoro de Barracuda, or The Treasure of Barracuda in English, based on the book series of the same name. This thrilling new pirate adventure
text: TRAILERS by July 21, 2025Source: YouTube "If you can read these pages, it means you are looking for my treasure." Filmax in Spain has revealed the first teaser trailer for a new animated adventure film titled El Tesoro de Barracuda, or The Treasure of Barracuda in English, based on the book series of the same name. This thrilling new pirate adventure has all the usual ingredients: secret maps, chases, naval battles, and unforgettable characters. On board the dreaded ship The Southern Cross, she's the only hope for an illiterate crew to find the legendary treasure of Phineas Krane. Together with Captain Barracuda & John La Ballena, protector of Sparks, they will form an unforgettable trio. The big twist: the pirates can't read. But Sparks will teach them! Of course. No voice cast is listed yet. From director Adrià García, the Spanish production is animated by Hampa Animation Studio in Valencia, produced by Inicia Films and Belvision. This is designed for kids, to teach them about the joys of reading, but it still looks like fun anyway. And this colorful 2D animation style is lovely. Check it out below. Here's the first teaser trailer (+ poster) for Adrià García's film El Tesoro de Barracuda, from YouTube: While trying to find her parents, Chispas ends up by accident on Captain Barracuda's pirate ship, manned by fearsome sailors armed to the teeth and with a serious problem: they can't read. Only she can help them find the treasure of Phineas Crane, the most valuable and coveted by all the pirates of the Caribbean. Thus begins an adventure that will change their lives forever. El Tesoro de Barracuda, which translates to The Treasure of Barracuda in English, is directed by Spanish animation filmmaker Adrià García, director of the film Nocturna and My Family and the Wolf previously. The screenplay is written by Amèlia Mora, adapted from the Spanish children's book of the same name written by Llanos Campos. Produced by Valérie Delpierre. Made by Inicia Films & Hampa Studio. Filmax will debut García's The Treasure of Barracuda in Spanish cinemas first starting on September 26th, 2025 in the fall. No US release date is set - stay tuned. html:
TRAILERS

by
July 21, 2025
Source: YouTube

"If you can read these pages, it means you are looking for my treasure." Filmax in Spain has revealed the first teaser trailer for a new animated adventure film titled El Tesoro de Barracuda, or The Treasure of Barracuda in English, based on the book series of the same name. This thrilling new pirate adventure has all the usual ingredients: secret maps, chases, naval battles, and unforgettable characters. On board the dreaded ship The Southern Cross, she's the only hope for an illiterate crew to find the legendary treasure of Phineas Krane. Together with Captain Barracuda & John La Ballena, protector of Sparks, they will form an unforgettable trio. The big twist: the pirates can't read. But Sparks will teach them! Of course. No voice cast is listed yet. From director Adrià García, the Spanish production is animated by Hampa Animation Studio in Valencia, produced by Inicia Films and Belvision. This is designed for kids, to teach them about the joys of reading, but it still looks like fun anyway. And this colorful 2D animation style is lovely. Check it out below.

Here's the first teaser trailer (+ poster) for Adrià García's film El Tesoro de Barracuda, from YouTube:

While trying to find her parents, Chispas ends up by accident on Captain Barracuda's pirate ship, manned by fearsome sailors armed to the teeth and with a serious problem: they can't read. Only she can help them find the treasure of Phineas Crane, the most valuable and coveted by all the pirates of the Caribbean. Thus begins an adventure that will change their lives forever. El Tesoro de Barracuda, which translates to The Treasure of Barracuda in English, is directed by Spanish animation filmmaker Adrià García, director of the film Nocturna and My Family and the Wolf previously. The screenplay is written by Amèlia Mora, adapted from the Spanish children's book of the same name written by Llanos Campos. Produced by Valérie Delpierre. Made by Inicia Films & Hampa Studio. Filmax will debut García's The Treasure of Barracuda in Spanish cinemas first starting on September 26th, 2025 in the fall. No US release date is set - stay tuned.

Find more posts in: Animation, Foreign Films, To Watch, Trailer
